column1: #Text=Kuopio is the largest city of North Savonia .
#Text=Kuopio is one of the many Finnish towns founded under Swedish rule .
#Text=The town was established as a village in the 1500s and incorporated as a city in 1782 .
#Text=Kuopio is surrounded by lakes from three sides , which supplies loads of beaches and the feeling of water being always close .
#Text=Part of the wooden houses arranged as a grid have been preserved in the centre which makes it a nice place to visit .
#Text=Kuopio Airport ( KUO ) ( is located 14 km north of Kuopio ) .
#Text=Kuopio is a one hour flight away from Helsinki .
#Text=Most flights are met by a bus connecting to the city centre .
#Text=As with most Finnish passenger airports nowadays , the only flights are to Helsinki by Finnair ( depending on the day 3-6 daily flights ) .
#Text=National highway 5 from Helsinki and highway 9 from Turku .
#Text=Kuopio is about a five hour drive from Helsinki .
#Text=Kuopio has a good system of public transport .
#Text=You can ride from one part of the city to another with a single ticket of € 3.3 , kids € 1.7 .
#Text=Kauppatori is the center of Kuopio 's public transport system , but be aware that many bus lines just pass through and continue somewhere to the other side of the city .
#Text=single ticket during the night ( 11PM-4AM ) : € 5 adults/€ 2,6 children 7 – 16 years
#Text=Information about local buses can be found here .
#Text=You can use route planner to seek local bus routes between given locations and addresses .
#Text=Lurks over the city on the highest hill far and wide .
#Text=From here you have a stunning view over the neighbouring lakelands .
#Text=The Orthodox Church Museum ( Ortodoksinen Kirkkomuseo ) , Karjalankatu 1 .
#Text=Is a leading museum of Orthodox Churches in Europe .
#Text=South east from the main square and you can just walk around following your feet .
#Text=The Minna Canth House ( Kanttila ) ( corner of Minna Canthin katu and Kuninkaankatu ) .
#Text=The original house where the famous first Finnish female writer Minna Canth lived .
#Text=Most noticeable it contains a replication of the Minna Canth room where she is said to have written some of her work .

#Text=In the old town has plenty of old buildings done up in their original style 150 years ago containing also a pharmacy museum and most enchantingly a little history of Wonderous Healers in Eastern Finland of which still two or three exist and offer their service to believing people today !
#Text=The Kuopio Market Hall ( Kauppahalli ) ( Located at the Market Square ) .
#Text=Opening hours During summer months ( June – August ) Mon - Fri 10AM - 6PM , Sat - Sun 11AM - 4PM , Winter ( September – May ) Tue-Thu-Fri 11AM - 5PM , Wed 11AM -7PM , Sat - Sun 11AM - 3PM .
#Text=The VB Photographic Centre is dedicated to display high-class Finnish and foreign photography .
#Text=The Centre is housed in an idyllic wooden building that is more than 100 years old and located in the heart of the Old City of Kuopio in Eastern Finland .
#Text=The VB Photographic Centre is regarded as one of the major photographic galleries and research centres of the country .
#Text=During the summer , the Centre organizes well-known international exhibitions .
#Text=A relatively flat marathon course with views of Lake Kallavesi .
#Text=Events inlcude full and half marathons and a 10 km for runners , and a 10 km walk .
#Text=An ice skating marathon with distances of 25 , 50 , 100 , and 200 km .
#Text=The track in 2018 was 12.5 km long , and it is available for anyone to use after the event has ended .
#Text=Offers large indoor and outdoor swimming pools , a jacuzzi , an ice-cold pool , a children 's pool , a waterslide , saunas and a steam room .
#Text=Passenger Boat Cruises . on Lake Kallavesi are worth trying during the summer season ( June – August ) .
#Text=Skiing only 1,5 km from the city centre .
#Text=Handmade clothes , records , comic books , 60s and 70s second hand shop , minigallery .
#Text=Three blocks from the Market Square is the idyllic Pikku-Pietari Market Alley , lined by old stables .
#Text=The log buildings of the alley house a cafe with a terrace , art exhibitions and small boutiques .
#Text=Special shop for sauna products in the Market Hall .
#Text=Alko is the national alcoholic beverage retailing monopoly in Finland .
#Text=Essentially , it is the only store in the country which retails beer over 4.7 % ABV , wine ( except in vineyards ) and spirits .
#Text=Alcoholic beverages are also sold in licensed restaurants and bars to ages 18 and up .

#Text=Alko is required by law to sell drinks with lower alcohol content than 4.7 % and non-alcoholic alternatives , but in practice carries a very limited stock of low alcohol beer , cider and non-alcoholic drinks and mixers as supermarkets sell the same products at a lower price .

#Text=Kalakukko fish pie , The best-known speciality in the province of Savo is probably the ‘ kalakukko ’ fish pie , a type of rye bread pie stuffed with fish ( the name literally means " fish rooster " ) .
#Text=Once you have tasted warm ‘ kalakukko ’ , it is hard to resist .
#Text=The best places for shopping for a genuine ‘ kalakukko ’ , consisting vendace or perch and bacon baked inside a rye crust , are the Market Hall and the Marketplace .
#Text=You should also try fried vendace ( muikku , a fresh-water fish ) at local kiosks and restaurants .
#Text=The bakery shop Kalakukkoleipomo Hanna Partanen boasts a long tradition in kalakukko baking .
#Text=Tasty fried small whitefish in a pub-like atmosphere , a real classic in Kuopio .
#Text=" Black Sheep " in English , the best restaurant in town , fine dining , pretty expensive .
#Text=A restaurant in the city centre , popular among adult people .
#Text=Open in July and for private occasions from May to December. .
